section.title: Module
section.para: The functionality enables you, on behalf of your company (the borrower), to view your company's loan account details and carry out actions such as drawdown requests and payments.

section.title: Basic Concepts
section.para: A facility is a credit line that is available to the borrower and whose basis is either a line letter or a credit agreement. A deal consists of one or more facilities. A deal is structured for a company by a bank or group of banks to meet the company's financial needs.
To use the modules in lending services, your company must have arranged a deal with the Issuing Bank.

In this chapter we often refer to an individual drawdown as a loan, and thus we use the terms drawdown and loan interchangeably. The term outstanding is also used to represent the current amount borrowed against an existing facility.

In some of the functions available in Loan Portal you will see the option Retrieve Unsigned. This functionality allows you to view transactions or messages to bank records that have already been initiated but, due to lack of authorisation have not been submitted. If you have the necessary privileges you may submit these unsigned records.

Click in the System Idcolumn to open records in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the company, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then displayed.
